column4: Why does this stuff have to regress so badly each new version of ubuntu
are you talking about the free equivalents of Flash?
Adobe make a Linux version of their flashplayer
so u suggest the offical adboe version and not ubuntu's
The Adobe version just plain works, and you know it's developed alongside the Windows version, which is the gold standard
ok cool going back to their version, like i said lucid played flash very well, on ubuntu's version, but yeah this sucks
I can't play youtube videos in lucid using any flashplayer other than Adobe's
but the Adobe one works perfectly.  If you can live with having non-open-source software on your puter
as long as it's free and not runing on windows, i don;'t care what license it has really
well it's just that it's an Adobe binary - they don't give you the source
np i found wher i need to place the flie

thanks dude, smooth fullscreen happiness. i should have thought of this before, been such a long time since i had to install adobe's version that I forgot that it was a solution back in the day, well in my case
as far as I'm concerned, the Adobe version is the only version, unless you're a FOSS diehard
